item.description:
I discovered this historic, hidden gem from another MeetUp group when I went geocaching in the area with my dog. This place is fantastic!
The quarry which was in operation for nearly a century, very suddenly ceased operations about 45+ years ago. It's as if all the humans had suddenly disappeared and never came back. Left behind is the equipment, remains of buildings, machinery, trucks, etc.
It has a great web of hiking trails, many marked with educational information for a self-guided walking tour.
Dogs are allowed, but should be under voice control and/or leash (preferably) at all times.
If going, be sure to bring your camera, comfortable hiking shoes or boots, water and snacks (for both you and your dog). Please be a responsible owner and bring at least a couple bags for your doggy's "business".
Hike should last about 2 to 3 hours depending on number of stops and trails taken.
You will not be disappointed!

Directions: Mass. Pike to Westfield Exit 3. Right out of tolls onto Rtes. 10/202 south. In downtown Westfield, right onto Franklin Street/Rte. 20 West. Quarry road is on LEFT approx. 3 miles from the Chester Fire Dept. (immediately after Wade Inn Road which will be on your right). Follow Quarry Road south/southwest for roughly 1.5 mile or so passing Gould Road on left. Quarry entrance will be on left a very short distance after that. For APPROXIMATE GPS/Nav systems, enter "500 Quarry Road, Becket, MA" For you geocachers use coordinates: Lat: 42 degrees 15' 05" N and Long: 73 degrees 01' 12" W
